Reviews.Title: “it´s ok”
Reviews.Author: MrsLikeke
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very noise because the hotel it´s in front of a crowd street and the bathrooms need a renovation NOW! The guy at the breakfast is very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen S
Reviews.Content: I am in our corporate office, two of our salesman went to Miami on business. They found a hotel on TripAdvisor. They were a bit concerned when they arrived at the hotel and saw prostitutes on the street. They went to the lobby which was locked; you had to be buzzed in which raised a second concern. They checked in went to the room and oh my, what a sleazy establishment!!! The mirror was cracked, stains on the pillows and bed coverlet, raw wood bed frame, closet and shelves. Towel bar in the bathroom ripped out of the wall and electrical wires hanging out of the light switch. Quickly decided not the place for them. They took pictures of the room. They went back and explained their dissatisfaction and wanted a refund. They were given a refund for only one night and were charged for two nights for two rooms on the original booking. No, problem they said, we will email the owners explain our dissatisfaction and obtain a refund. Well the owners of the property would not budge. So then they say they would have the corporate payables department dispute the charge with MasterCard. The dispute was sent off with pictures off all the things wrong with the room and a copy of the email sent to the owners. Weeks later we get a letter back from MasterCard telling us that the folio was signed and the key accepted and that constituted checking in and no refund would be do us. So, do not stay here and do not take a key, do not sign anything, use only American Express who is better with at protecting their customers than MasterCard and if in doubt RUN FORREST RUN. The owners obviously know what they can get away with and have a real scam going. You would think you were in a third world county.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean Deco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue F
Reviews.Content: We arrive to Miami the night before a cruise and needed a place to put our heads for the the night. This wasn't a 'destination hotel' for us, but this hotel was perfect for our needs. Small clean rooms but fun, art deco decor. Continental breakfast in a welcoming courtyard was a nice a touch and much appreciated. Miami is a big city, so it's quite a ways to the downtown piers/South Beach area which might factor into the cost if you need transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth at all. What a wrongly self-called "boutique hotel"!”
Reviews.Author: darkbador
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing: VERY NOISY (and they know it because there are COMPLEMENTARY 2 pairs of earplugs on the night table)! Then they claim that all local and national calls are free; BUT THERE IS NO PHONE IN 50% of ROOMS (including mine)!!! Finally, only one night table in the room (is this "fashion"???) and at 8:30 am, already NO MORE BREAD at breakfast!!! This has been my worst experience in Miami for over $111 (with tax); NOT WORTH AT ALL.

Reviews.Title: “The New (No) Yorker and things you should know about Miami”
Reviews.Author: Aquarius74
Reviews.Content: The hotel: Although the hotel is not too expensive if you compare it with other hotels for Miami, you still have to pay more than $ 100,- per night if you stay longer than 5 nights. First of all I asked for a room in the back and because I stayed for 6 nights I assumed that they would have given me a room in the back...not. It is true, if you have a room in the front there is a lot of traffic noise from Biscayne Boulevard. The earplugs were very welcome. Secondly, breakfast is very very simple, do not expect too much. There is a Starbucks and a Subway across the street for those who fancy a nicer breakfast. I always had breakfast in Miami Beach, at Juice and Java. Thirdly, the rooms are a bit worn out and everything is very old, especially the bathroom. Fourthly, the hotel is very far away from everything, you definately need a car and you will have to drive for about 30 minutes to get to Miami Beach! I would not recommend the New Yorker for a stay in Miami. I would advise travellers to book a B&B in Miami Beach or a big hotel in the neighbourhood of the airport if you want to stay low-budget as you have to drive to the beach anyway. Miami Miami is big, very big. You will have to drive for more than 40 minutes to get out of the city. I would recommend everybody to take a rental car with a pass for the toll and express roads inclusive. Key West is from Miami not doable in one day, you will have to stay overnight. I turned around half way and spend almost the whole day in the car. Although everone says that Miami is for the rich and famous I was not very impressed by the city. It attracts a lot of wannabees and people who like to show off. It was so now and then a bit tacky (people in bikinis in the shopping area). The shopping area around Lincoln Road is nice in the evenings. The shops, mostly small boutiques, are open till late every evening. I also went to Aventura, which is situated between Miami and F. Lauderdale. This is a big shopping mall with nice brands. If you want to shop for a bargain, the Dolphin Mall is probably better. Here you can find outlet stores from the big brands. Everglades I did the bike tour in Shark Valley and it was really nice. The bike tour will take 2 till 3 hours and bikes can be rented at the visitors center for $ 8,- per hour. During the first part of the route you will see a lot of alligators, more than during the popular propellor boat tours.

Reviews.Title: “Visit historic Miami”
Reviews.Author: suzangelo
Reviews.Content: We were going overnight to Miami for a cruise the next day. We shopped on the internet for a room, not too far from the airport and not too far from the port. Had been there before but wanted to visit a new part of miami (North). We were told that it was a let down part of the city,but we decided to try it anyway. Let me tell you that we had a wonderful time. This hotel is very accessable by bus ,taxi and they offer shuttle service to/from airport and port of Miami for a reasonable fee. We were greeted with great respect and shown to a very clean and "Themed room" Amy Whinehouse. It is very comfortable and offers a pool and such a very cozy and relaxing terrase where you can sit at night for drinks and enjoy a complimentary and quite complete breakfast in the morning.The staff is amazing in greeting and directing you with all of your needs. We were lucky enough to meet the owners and were impressed with their dedication to their patrons.Walter thank-you for your hospitality. I recommende this cozy personalised hotel for anyone looking to visit historic Miami in the security and comfort of a very freindly place.

Reviews.Title: “Read This Before Booking :)”
Reviews.Author: texastravelAustin
Reviews.Content: Hi, I do not understand the bad reviews for this hotel? If you read the Travel Advisor reviews, they are spot-on truthful. This is a BUDGET hotel for a Miami-budget price. My 5 stars are for the BUDGET category. $150 (includes expensive daily hotel tax) is a GOOD rate during the boat show/Sobe Food & Wine Festival/Obama visit. It's a $25 taxi ride to and from ($50 total) to get to beautiful South Beach. Their newly decorated breakfast area is lovely. Breakfast is cofee, cereal, toast. No eggs or waffles or yogurt. Coffee is OK and beds are comfortable. I'll add pics when I get home. ****** oh, The shuttle service is NOT free ******** I told them I'll make that clear because several booking sites are advertising a free shuttle for them. They have a $10 (more than 1 person) to $15 (single passenger) shuttle service to airport. The employees at this hotel are VERY NICE. The shuttle driver went way out if his way to rush me to South Beach for a deadline. Then he delivered my bag to the hotel. We will stay there again simply for the nice stafff. The bus stop is across the street (1 minute) and a $2 fee + 50 min bus ride delivers you to a wonderful mall!! Hubby and I spent a full rainy day there. Lovely sushi restaurant upstairs and GREAT shopping. Every store you love is there. If you love espresso....Sur La Table is serving gorgeous complimentary ones (new brand of technology). Back to the hotel......the shower is like a sprinkle. It's completely fine for budget, but you may yell out if someone in another hotel room flushes a toilet and you lose cold water for a few seconds. Also, our room didn't have an electric plug in bathroom. No biggie for me, but I know that some people need their bathroom routine. Ot's an old hotel and you should expect that if you book. Please don't stay there and then trash them for finding a hair. That is truly not a clutch-your-pearls moment.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Misrepresentation”
Reviews.Author: Linda N
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel kind of last minute for two nights during the Miami International Boat Show. We were skeptical upon arrival, but the front desk clerk said that the travel channel was there recently to film a show that would air in April, so we thought maybe the rooms were better than the front lobby appeared, and didn't think we would find anything else during this event. We were not overly impressed with our rooms either, especially when we found that they supplied ear plugs on the bedside table. So we went to dinner immediately upon check-in and stayed there for several hours because we did not want to go back to the hotel. In the morning it got even worse when my husband got into the shower to find a foreign hair and that the shower curtain did not reach the ledge, therefore spilling an enormous amount of water onto the entirely tiled room and he almost fell getting out. The last straw was going into the cupboards and finding a roach. We checked out a night early and the hotel would not refund our money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean & cute hotel, area leaves a bit to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Erin A
Reviews.Content: I needed an overnight hotel close to the airport and chose this little gem. It was $80 bucks including tax and my room was basic but clean, comfortable and adorably decorated. I'll agree it was a tad noisy in the rooms at the front of the hotel but I wasn't expecting much and I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel across he board. I love that there was a fridge and 2 complimentary bottles of water in my room. The breakfast area in the back courtyard is a cool place to take unwind. I didn't get to the pool but it looked clean and refreshing. The area is nothing special to say the least but if you had a car staying here you'd be golden. I agree with one of the other reviewers who said that the front desk only gave one restaurant recommendation and it was for a place they had some affiliation with down the street.

Reviews.Title: “No problem for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: alexjharper
Reviews.Content: Not in a great location but fine for a short stay. The rooms are OK, the staff are helpful and the breakfast is fine. You wouldnt want to stay for more than a night or two but this hotel does provide value for money. It can get a little noisy as the hotel is on a busy road.

Reviews.Title: “I will say Average, but acctually mean Good”
Reviews.Author: theED
Reviews.Content: as there is no middle ground between Average and Very good I will lean more towards the Average. The hotel is situated on the Biscayne road same road that takes you to the sea port (about 10 mins drive) and it is close to the cos-worth to Miami beach, haven't said the location it self is not great, we arrived at night and many scruffy charterers lurked around maybe to the liqueur store few feet away from the Hotel. We stayed here as other hotels in Miami where crazy expensive. This hotel I believe is from the 50's, and you do get that vibe. and although old I did get a refurbishment and the rooms are clean and modern (ish), however was not crazy about the street noise transmitted nor the sounds from my upstairs neighbors who apparently his wooden planked floor is my ceiling with no isolation between. You should expect something is up when the hotel provide free ear plugs by your bed instead of mint chocolates. at the reception the staff is friendly, an elderly (but not saying she is old "in case she reads this review") was sweat and she was defiantly a character. She allowed to use her computer at the reception to print out stuff as the computer provided for guest was not hoked up to a printer. Another person worth a mention is a young black guy who I think was a bus-boy or something. he greeted every body who came for breakfast with enthusiasm and offered if he can bring you anything that you did not see at the breakfast counter his attitude literally lifts you up in the morning. free WiFi, free breakfast (cerals, bagels, coffee and juice) free parking (not many of them) Actually Not bad,

Reviews.Title: “Nice to look at but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: scenesteruk
Reviews.Content: This is a bargain hotel. Bear in mind that your room is likely to be small and potentially noisy. i had a night of disturbed sleep - the people upstairs sounded like a herd of elephants. Also, I was a bit disappointed that when I asked the staff at the desk for recommendations for places to eat and drink they only recommended one place down the street where you get a discount. For female or single travellers I would warn that the street where the hotel is located is probably not the best place to wander late at night. I felt a little unsafe in the area. Although clearly up and coming it is still a bit rough around the edges. Things I liked: the decor - whole 50s vibe is cool. Also, the price.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money - awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline P
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the New Yorker with a friend and I was amazed by the staff: I had problems getting my suitcase as it got lost and Mimi and her team were incredibly supportive and helpful. They genuinely care about their customers, which is a refreshing change from most hotels. The room itself was very comfy, albeit a little dated but to me, it just added to the Art Deco charm! No AC but a very effective (and silent) ceiling fan. There is a pool but we didn't use it. There is an affordable shuttle to the airport or the port (15mns drive each). Breakfast was simple but fresh and served in a lovely veranda. If anything, we were disappointed not to stay longer! highly recommended - great price for the location, and again, you will be getting great service from the team (if there was a 6th star, it would go to Mimi!)

Reviews.Title: “Fly, drive or cruise in...”
Reviews.Author: Becky H
Reviews.Content: We spent several days pre and post-cruise. The owners and staff are friendly & helpful. The hotel has a cool art deco/mid-century charm & is located on old Rt. 1. The courtyard is a nice place for breakfast & relaxation. The pool is clean. Free-use computer in the lobby & WiFi in the rooms. Comfortable bed. Rooms away from the street are quietest, but the sound proofing between communicating rooms could be better. The area was fairly quiet at night, not a lot of sirens or drag-racers! This is a transitional area of old buildings being renovated & cleaned up...Starbucks a block away. Take a shuttle or taxi to & from the airport and port. Local bus service is good for malls and sightseeing. (Day Pass) Car parking for those who drive in. Good restaurants in the area. Less expensive than Miami Beach. The fitness park across the street & walks through the neighborhoods (along the water) are okay by day, but don't walk at night. This hotel is a good value and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: YoungFriend
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, the bathroom clean but very small. We got a lot of noise from street, though we were so tired, slept anyway. The breakfast in the garden was lovely. Friendly reception. Fast internet.

Reviews.Title: “1950s Revisited”
Reviews.Author: Tim K
Reviews.Content: This a a great retro "Motel", circa 1950s in decor. The place is especially clean and the rooms are decorated differently, but definately retro and cool. For our purpose, night before a cruise, it was great....really clean and comfortable. The courtyard where the ample continental breakfast was served is so chic and "Miami", really neat. The pool area is especially nice. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat....and it's only 4 Mi North of the Port of Miami. Staff is also extremely friendly, and good restaraunts with great (prices) happy hours are less than a block away.Quite a Gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcie S
Reviews.Content: Everything about the New Yorker was good. The personnel is extremely helpful and friendly, very accommodating. The rooms were clean and had everything you needed. The location is close to down town and to south beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to begin our trip!”
Reviews.Author: SWLover
Reviews.Content: We didn't know what to expect from the neighborhood at first. The area is being re-done and there are a lot of trendy new restaurants and bars with a vintage feel. We ended up having a great time exploring! Our room was very nice and I can't say enough about the staff. They worked hard to make sure we didn't need anything and recommended a place for lunch (you get 10% off there with a New Yorker room key). The breakfast area was a nice surprise. At home, we are very rushed and it was nice to sit down, enjoy, and relax, even after we were finished eating. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: BRY123BRY
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked this hotel had a 4 star rating from Trip Advisor. Online, the hotel looks Chic and clean. In reality, my room (215), which was supposed to have been recently rennovated had a stain on the pillow, a cracked mirror, unfinished plywood shelves and bed, exposed electrical on the entry switch and a broken towel rack inside the shower. See pics below. I'm astounded at some of the other reviews quite honestly. I initially politley asked for a refund, but there was no manager on site and the owner was unavailable. When the front desk clerk (who was very nice) called the manager, she declined to refund my money even though I never stayed a night in the hotel room. I have tried to contact the hotel owner but she will not return my calls. One of the front desk employees did tell me that they were going to refund my stay for one of the three nights I booked. Since I booked the rooms for two people that totaled a refund for $180 out of the $512 it cost me.The location was not ideal as the part of town was run down. This is not a property I would feel comfortable reccommending. I ended up finding another hotel in a better part of town that was a national brand. I am still pursuing a full refund but have been unable to speak with the owner to confirm that.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: Cristiano N
Reviews.Content: Nice place for its price range, good breakfast, extremelly helpful personnel. Really a must-go. Only down factor is its distance from Miami Beach. Otherwise, great.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but noisy”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkjMvoyager
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Yorker for 4 nights (getting a 10% discount by booking directly on their website) in a corner room with two queen beds. The room was nicely decorated and big but it's a good thing it came with complimentary earplugs because the noise from busy Biscayne ave was constant. Not to mention from our neighbors... Our room, 105, had a communicating door with the room next door and we could hear every word of the regular conversations the other people were having, not to mention the noise above head (this is a converted motel so 2 levels, and apparently acrobats moved in on day 2). Two perks though: free parking and a free breakfast buffet (bagels, cereal, orange juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, apples, and bananas) in the morning. The neighborhood is not the best but there are some good restaurants right down the street, within walking distance: Balans (10% discount with your room key) and tastier Uvas. There is also the brand new Blue Collar and fantastic Michy's.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Tim T
Reviews.Content: We loved it as son as we walked in the door. Everybody is so nice and friendly. The rooms were really clean and fresh. All the public areas are beautiful. The guy who handled the breakfast (Charles) were so helpfull and kind, made us smile every morning. We got alot of help from the staff in the lobby (especially Geri) and alot of tips where to go and what to do on our vaccation. The only thing that was negative was the location, but it only took 40 mins to get to the beach by bus. If you have a car that would'nt be a problem. If we come to Miami again we would defenitly come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, nice room”
Reviews.Author: MarV3
Reviews.Content: Located at a busy street. Rooms at the front are noisy, room with trendy furniture, nice. Great personel and a good breakfast on the patio. Very charming. Enough parkingspace. Good restaurant on the opposite (Balans), 10 % discount by showing your key.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: ClauditaConcepcion
Reviews.Content: Since we wanted to buy some things in Miami, we decided to stay 2 days in Collins Avenue and the look for a cheaper hotel. The New Yorker is great, people ther is so friendly and they gave us tips on were to go. Room wasn't that big, but ok for us..had a litlle fridge, bathroom was clean, free parking, free internet and nice continental breakfast. If you want to save some money and stay in a nice place i'll recommend it. Now remember it's not a chain hotel, not Collins Avenue so the neighborhood is not as nice, but it's safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel not nice neighberhood”
Reviews.Author: gorocreep
Reviews.Content: It is a hotel although it looks like a motel. The decoration of the rooms is very decco and with style. All rooms have A/C and a little fridge with free water bottles. They even have small amenities like shampoo and soap. The place is quite nice, the breakfast is great and is sooo close to Miami beach, only 8-10 Min by car! Good things: The staff is very friendly, is easy to find, the breakfast is very nice with juice, cereals, bagles, breads and ham. Free parking and its very close to Miami Beach So-So Things: It is right in the "downtown" where the faces you see are sketchy and couldnÂ´t really sleep to my hearts content because the parking is right beside the street and always had the idea it could be stolen, but proved me wrong...its very safe. Bad Things: The bed had a sqeuaky sound everytime I or my GF moved and a VERY loud squeak, I usually drop like a stone but that noise could really wake me and that menat a poor night sleep. The neighberhood is not very nice but it does have a taco bell in a decent car distance. NOTHING is close in walking distance. Advise: In miami you are nothing without a car...RENT ONE!

Reviews.Title: “A great time at the New Yorker”
Reviews.Author: AndreJebe
Reviews.Content: We, a couple, slept 2 nights at the New Yorker. I have absolutely nothing to complaint about. We had first a queen deluxe room, but as the light wasn't working very well they upgraded us to a king deluxe room without any supplement. The staff was helpful (my greetings to Charles !), the breakfast excellent and the room clean, all this for a very nice price. I can't imagine a better deal in Miami !

Reviews.Title: “Very good staff”
Reviews.Author: Daniel A
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the Hotel was very Helpfull and friendly, I think that is their best asset. The Hotel is very good and with a low cost. I Recomend it. They upgrade me because we were on our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “nice family stay at the New Yorker's , Miami”
Reviews.Author: Siheme S
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the New Yorker's. The staff was amazing, very helpful and kind. The room was clean, the decoration was nice. We were with our 5 months old baby and everything was perfect for us ! We highly recommend this place if you're looking for something simple but clean, affordable and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint place to stay, great location, very personable staff”
Reviews.Author: 231Kathycasey
Reviews.Content: We came to visit friends in Miami, and booked at the New Yorker because it was close to Miami Shores. It is a very convienient location. Other reviewers state that it is in a bad part of town....welcome to MIAMI - It is a big city, with "bad parts" around every corner. The New Yorker has privacy fencing and we felt extremely safe and relaxed. Charles, the breakfast attendant was so friendly and helpful...always with a smile on his face. The rooms were clean and comfortable. Free WI FI. Free parking - even though parking can be a little tricky (as it is everywhere in Miami) If you need help with that - see Charles - he'll take care of you. It's not the ritz - but we didn't pay for the ritz. If the noise of the city bothers you - then don't stay in Miami - it's a big noisy city. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price we paid.”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl02
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonably priced hotel for a two night stay in Miami Shores near Barry University. It didn't need to have good access to beaches because we were going to be busy with other things anyway. I chose the New Yorker based on all the glowing reviews. Boy were we shocked! This hotel is in a very bad part of town! I was with my daughter and we did not feel safe in this neighborhood. We would have moved had I not already prepaid for the room. We made sure we were back in the room by 10pm and didn't walk around after dark. The morning we walked to a Starbucks a couple blocks away we saw prostitutes and probably drug deals. The only thing that made us feel like we would be ok here was the volume of other reviews saying they had stayed there and obviously lived to tell the tale. There were also many police cars around. Like others have said, the walls are paper thin, bathrooms tiny and furnishings cheap. The bed was fairly comfortable and the TV was a nice flat screen. I didn't like the fact that I could not control the a/c. Overall I think the owners are trying but they will never be able to overcome the thin walls and tiny bathrooms unless they do some major renovations. Also, I don't see that the area is "up and coming" as some have said and that is also a huge deterrent to staying there. I feel like I was fooled by all the glowing recommendations. I wonder if the owners and/or employees put them there.???

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jiannan
Reviews.Content: I really love this motel. I lost my boots there, and they sent them back for me! Also, they paid the fee for me!!! I am so moved:)

Reviews.Title: “Bad credit card experience 5 month after my stay”
Reviews.Author: Noneof y
Reviews.Content: Stay experience was satisfactory for the price but what happened a few months later was NOT. My daughter and I both had faudulent charges appear on our credit cards. First my daughter's card was hit then a few months later mine. The charges that appeared are from GTL Global TelLINK and they are going to a correctional facility account for an inmate. So, someone employed at the New Yorker Boutique Hotel is stealing or selling your credit card information for a person that is in Jail! Beware! I hope they get caught!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Marieve_bc
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this hotel, the room was very clean, the bed very confortable and breakfest was free ! Yes the walls are thin but earplugs did the trick, also get a room looking at the pool, less noisy. The neighborhood was a little weird but ok for one night!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price!”
Reviews.Author: 1stCircumdedistiMe
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night and yes the walls are very thin, but if you are not hyper sensitive to sound it is no big deal. Even if you are you are one, you can use the complimentary ear plugs. The internet, the TV and cable were great. The beds were great. The bathroom was not a nice as the rest of the room. Be mindful this is a Motel, albeit not a cheap one like travelsingdance s uggests. For what I paid for one night, I would have had to go to a hostel with 4 other strangers in bunk beds. Obviously, travelsingdance has no idea of the ongoing prices of Miami Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem at an Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: hannhol
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of a longer 9 night stay in Miami and Key West. Becuase of our further travel plans we couldn't afford to spend a lot, and so the more central locations of Miami and Miami Beach were outside of our budget. Staying for 4 nights gave us a discount which again brought down the price meaning that our stay (booked direct) came in at just less than $50 a night including breakfast. Having done our research we had requested a quieter room at the back of the hotel which we were accomodated with and we booked a transfer from the hotel as we were not planning to hire a car in the first few days. The room was very nice and clean. The main criticisms would be, there was no phone (and they do advertise all rooms as having a phone and there was very little storage space in the bathroom, no where to put your toilettries and so forth. Also on the first night the shower didn't work, and they really should have checked the facilities when we moved in. TV and internet both worked really well. The room also had an iron and ironing board (very useful for the crumpled traveller!) and a fridge which was kept stocked with water. Breakfast was simple, but good. Bagels and cream cheese and jams, some cereals, coffee and tea making facilities. It was simple, but many US hotels don't include breakfast, and again for what we paid we thought it was good value. There is a diner and a Starbucks within easy walking distance for anyone that wants more. In terms of location, it's not in the 'nicest' part of town, some of the surroundings are a little shabby, but we never felt unsafe and being British did a lot of walking around. If you take the time to walk up the road, there are some great restaurants (including 'Michy's' which seems to be rated as one of the best in Miami, sadly we couldn't afford it! :)). There are also good bus links to the rest of Miami, including Miami Beach and South Beach. The hotel also offers a reasonably priced shuttle service so one night we booked that and it cost a lot less than a taxi. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay, the staff, including owners, were very friendly, the room was comfy and it was excellent value for money. It also gave us the opportunity to see a different side to Miami away from the obvious sights. We really enjoyed the architecture of the 'upper east side' which is certainly up and coming and I ahve no doubt that in a couple of years, it may ever be out of our budget!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent | comfortable & efficient team”
Reviews.Author: jd81
Reviews.Content: I stay in Newyorker just for 1 night, but i need to get alot of things (shipping packages, shuttle services, morning alarm by th ereceptionist, work on a good internet connection, shuttle services,...). Weel my stay was very comfortable and will be back everytime I need to go to Miami for a quick visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Convenient and Cheap!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler60827
Reviews.Content: I stayed here fore 5 nights on Columbus Weekend. It was perfect for my needs. The room was clean and a good size for me. I traveled by myself and I had two very comfortable beds. I read the reviews of this motel before I reserved and one person advised that I request a room with my own AC unit, iron and ironing board. I did so because I wasn't sure if all the rooms were equipped with that. My requests were met and i was very comfortable. The room also came with a mini-fridge, which was stocked daily with two bottles of water. There was daily house keeping, as well. The bathroom was a bit outdated, but it was functional and clean. I had no issues with bed bugs or bugs in general. It rained alot that weekend and I had a minor issue with water coming into the room from under the door. I informed the front office and someone was at my room within 10 minutes. In addition, the employees here were very nice to me. I needed to print something and I was able to email it to the front desk and they printed it for me. The parking is a bit tight but it's free so it was perfect. It is on Biscayne Blvd, but the noise did not bother me at all. The tv channels are limited but that did not matter to me. The neighborhood is definitely not a glamorous one. However, it is not the worse. If you're looking for a South Beach kind of a feel then this is not the place for you. If you're looking for a comfortable and affordable place, this is definitely a good place to look. I would stay here again in my future travels.

Reviews.Title: “You will love this Motel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahgs_11
Reviews.Content: The people at the New Yorker are so nice. The desk clerks were all very helpful. The motel is an older motel that has been remodeled. We slept on a pillow top bed and the pillows were very comfortable. The rooms are very clean and we had great water presure in the shower. The room was very comfortable because the air conditioning worked great. We used the suttle 3 times and the drivers were great, very interesting. The shuttle is a brand new Toyota van. The swimming pool is great, very clean. The breakfast is outside in the courtyard. They have bagels and toppings, toast, cereal, bananas, coffee, cold milk and juice. We were very happy with the breakfast and we enjoyed eating outside, instead of a crowded room.

Reviews.Title: “staff are great. a little bit of work and would be perfect.”
Reviews.Author: isyns
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, room at the back, upper level opposite the pool. Good location if you have a car (free parking). Rooms are nice, with a clean and simple design. Staff are very helpful. Few minor issues: shower floor could do with a bit of work (new tiles, grout) as it looks dirty and constant vibration and noise from the (assume) airconditioner made it difficult to sleep and ended up giving me a headache. I used the earplugs provided however couldn't hear my alarm so slept in! Also had a weird experience with the ceiling light and fan which came on by itself on 3 separate occasions on my first night when I was sleeping. WT?

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when you're in Miami”
Reviews.Author: OmiSade
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New Yorker for a week over the Labor Day holiday. I was visiting some friends and wanted to be close to them. The New Yorker was perfect! There were some glitches with my room the first night and I was immediately moved and told that if I wanted a room away from the main strip that they would move me again the following morning. True to their word, they moved me to a really huge, really quiet room. There were ear plugs on the night stand, but to be perfectly honest, I live in the City and did not notice an abundance of noise that would keep me awake. The staff at the New Yorker were friendly and helpful and the rooms were very clean. I had to chase the housekeeper down to give her the tips I had left for her each day because she left the money on the table! :- ) I really look forward to my next trip to Miami in December and definitely plan on staying at the New Yorker.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Rokkitsci G
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! Without spending a fortune, we stayed in a clean, attractive hotel minutes from downtown Miami. And the staff is uniformly polite, helpful, and friendly. Would recommend the New Yorker in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DeeAZPhoenix
Reviews.Content: I just had to take a moment to express what a wonderful experience I had at the New Yorker Boutique Hotel in Miami! It started with Jerry at the front desk... very warm and welcoming!!! The use of the computer in the lobby 24 hours a day available to check email and more... Free parking for my car... Free Wifi in my room... (if I had my laptop... next time)... The breakfast buffet (bagels, cereal coffee and juice) in the 'garden' was just lovely... soft tropical breeze and enjoyable music playing... Many guests also out and enjoying the free breakfast.... My room was clean with a High Def flat screen TV and HBO included... also, a remote to control the lighting all from the comfort of my bed.... scented soaps and shampoo.... WOW... love love loved it... I WILL BE BACK!!!! You can feel comfortable 'saving money' and still know you will have a GREAT experience too.... Thanks so much!!!! Dee from AZ

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie G
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here before going on a cruise.. The staff was absolutely Amazing! Very accomodating and sweet.The room was decorated very cute and contemporary, comfortable bed, lil mini frig, very clean.. The staff was very helpful by giving us a ride to our cruise ship the next morning even though we were running late.. Can't say enough about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and customer service”
Reviews.Author: JcSmithLondon
Reviews.Content: I stumbled across this hotel on trip advisor and read through some of the reviews: they don't do the hotel justice! We were warmly greeted into the extremely clean and well maintained reception area. We were slightly early so we went back out and checked in somewhat later into our rooms that reflected the quality of the reception. My only complaint was that the shower was a little too powerful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would have no qualms in paying at least $50 more a night!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Miami on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: fil_rouge_42
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel if you are travelling on a limited budget. My husband and I stayed there one week for 45$ (33â‚¬) per night which is the ultimate deal, and we got absolutely value for our money. The rooms are tastefully furnished and very clean, the king size bed we chose upon reservation was as comfortable as the ones you find in 5 * hotels. The pool was quite wide and very clean, the complimentary breakfast very good (bagels,jams,cereals,milk,coffee,tea,fruit juice) and the free wi-fi connectivity worked well except one day. The staff in the lobby is very kind helpful with whatever you may ask. The only two defects I found in this hotel are: the temperature in the rooms is far too cool ,Europeans like us cannot stand such cold,we're not used to wild air conditioned, and the problem is you don't have an individual control on air conditioned in your room so you just have to bear the freeze.I suggest anyone who's not used to heavy air conditioned to take sweatsuits with them to wear when not in bed (the blankets are soft and warm anyway); The second thing I did not like is the room maids, who are the "tip me or I'll pretend to forget to tidy up some details here and there as I clean your room". So be aware if you don't leave some dollars on the table as you leave your room they won't clean up your sink. Anyway our stay at the New Yorker was amazing, and I don't even complain about these two little defects because for 45$ per night what we got was far more than a five stars experience. I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back!”
Reviews.Author: EssieBonaire
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The New Yorker was very satisfying. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the staff was extremely friendly.Free internet and parking is also a big plus. We didn't feel uncomfortable with the area at all. Also the noise complaints I read about: not at all a problem. (And we had a room at the roadside.) We will definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Local Secret”
Reviews.Author: Daniel O
Reviews.Content: Lovely little motel hidden away in Northern Miami - very good for South Beach and downtown by car. Staff friendly, lovely pool and breakfast included. Parking a little tight, and don't expect to walk to too many destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Homely”
Reviews.Author: vernacia_ali
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Miami, my husband and I visted for a 8 night 7 days vacation. My stay at the New Yorker was extremely satisfying, rooms clean, beds comfortable, pool inviting...I must compliment the staff, MiMi (a), Shirley, Walter and the breakfast guy......amazing customer service...I will definately go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Place in a not-so-classy area”
Reviews.Author: w999
Reviews.Content: Free Breakfast, Free Parking, Free Internet! Courteous staff, cool rooms and comfortable beds. Only downside is the area isn't the greatest but the hotel is safe. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: josemarinof
Reviews.Content: The motel is located about 20-30 minutes from sobe but to visit Miami you'll need a car anyway. The only major coment i'd have would the room size (good for 1 person) and the medium breakfast (free) but they offer free wifi (rooms inclusive), free parking ( for Miami is a diferecial) and have great staff and prices too. Definily recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value”
Reviews.Author: Celia J
Reviews.Content: The New Yorker boutique hotel was a pleasure at first sight! It's vintage outdoor lighting is in keeping with the ambience of its location in historical "Little Haiti'. The area is convenient to the airport and on a main boulevard so I think those staying for a Miami experience would find getting around convenient. The friendly desk clerk welcomed me and directed me not only to my room but to a great restaurant on the next block. (Show your room key for a ten percent discount on your meal.) The retro style room was clean and well-equipped but the real delight was the top-of-the-line bedding, very luxurious! I spent a relaxing night, using the staff-provided earplugs to minimize traffic sounds. Next morning I enjoyed great coffee and breakfast items before my free airport shuttle. I can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “terrible! un'esperienza terribile”
Reviews.Author: gabriela g
Reviews.Content: the position is terrible, there's no way to go anywhere without a car. when we asked the reception to call a taxy for us they said they had a cab driver that was very nice and did special prices for the hotel, too bad the prices where actually higher than the regular ones (56 $ + tip to go and go back to south beach). the neighbourhood is full of prostitutes and weird sketchy people and we didn't feel safe at all. The rooms were pretty big and nice but the bathroom was extremely tiny and not that much clean. Last but not least they charged the total amount of money on the credit card (we were staying 2 nights) before we arrived and signed even if we were meant to pay at the arrival and we had been told it was not necessary to pay with the same credit card we used to make the reservation (me and my boyfriend wanted to split and it wasn't possible) and even if our booking allowed us to have a free cancellation. La posizione Ã¨ terribile, Ã¨ assolutamente impossibile raggiungere qualsiasi posto senza una macchina. Quando abbiamo chiesto alla reception di chiamarci un taxi ci hanno mandato un certo Gino che doveva fare prezzi di favore ai clienti dell'hotel. Nonostante sia stato molto gentile purtroppo abbiamo pagato 56 $+ mancia per andare e tornare da south beach contro i 48 richiesti da un taxi regolare, inoltre, dovendogli telefonare per il ritorno, siamo stati costretti ad aspettarlo oltre mezz'ora dopo l'orario pattuito. il quartiere Ã¨ pieno di prostitute e personaggi inquietanti e non Ã¨ assolutamente sicuro. Le camere erano piuttosto belle e spaziose ma il bagno era minuscolo e non molto pulito. Infine ci hanno addebitato l'intero importo dell'hotel sulla carta di credito che avevamo usato per la prenotazione nonostante avessimo diritto alla cancellazione gratuita e nonostante fosse specificato che quella carta di credito sarebbe servita solo da garanzia e che una volta arrivati avremmo potuto pagare anche in contanti o con altre carte.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: wolfeyes
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online because the price was "right". The hotel manager came to pick us up from the airport. Now where do you get that and when we coordinated our times he would drive us to where we needed to go and pick us up like a pre-arranged taxi service but at lower price. Him and his staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best price + good location + breakfast + free parking = New Yorker”
Reviews.Author: Andrei V
Reviews.Content: We were there and recommend it to all who seek a hotel for the best value, great location for AirPort, Sawgrass, Down Town, Miami Beach, Market and restaurants. The staff always serve you well ! I'll back for sure. If you need any help or information is only talk to Walter ... he will certainly help you! Hugs to all of the New Yorker. Andrei e Ju SC / Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and cost-benefit ratio”
Reviews.Author: fabiobrsp
Reviews.Content: I got a very good rate at this hotel. Actually, it is in essence a motel, but with excellent service and modern and updated premisses. The included breakfast is simple but good enough. Location is good, but not excellent (you will need a car). The family running the hotel is very nice, as is the staff. They stored several boxes I ordered which arrived before my check-in date. Thanks a lot! I would say that, at this price point, New Yorker is a good option for both people wanting above average motels and people wanting a good hotel for almost a motel price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Schiepchen
Reviews.Content: We visited Miami for three nights and enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Our room was spacious and had a clean and modern design. We liked the design of this hotel (former motel) in general since it reminded us of the typical art deco design. Getting there by car is probably the easiest way (parking is free). Since we didn't have one we arranged airport pick-up and drop-off with the hotel which worked perfectly fine and was a better value than taking a taxi. During our stay we preferred exploring Miami and Miami Beach by bus - there is a bus stop close to the hotel that takes you downtown. The hotel also provided a free breakfast which included bagels, cereals, coffee, tea, fresh fruit and juice and was a nice extra to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed this hotel, great value & had the best sleep!”
Reviews.Author: annalovestotravel
Reviews.Content: I loved the renovation job of this gorgeous deco style boutique hotel motel. Rooms were quite spacious and very comfortable (with feather pillows!!) and lovely comfy quilt and mattress. The room was serviced every day and very clean. Our room was at the back and looked onto the pool which meant that we had no problems with any noise from Biscayne Boulevard. But in any case ear plugs are provided in every room. A basic but decent breakfast was included - cereals, croissants, toast, fresh fruit, juice etc which guests eat in a nice outdoor area surrounded by orchids & potplants. The hotel had parking and was very close to buses going downtown or to Ventura Mall (about 10-15 mins either way). The area was in the historic Biscayne Boulevard MiMO area which is both funky and a bit edgy with some under-privileged areas nearby. Nearby are some nice furnishing shops but also and a great Balans restaurant & American noodles restaurant nearby. Guests get 10 percent off the Balans menu. Food was really good quality there. And try Danny's Lo Mein at American noodles. The rates were very reasonable and good value for money and the reception/owners very helpful. They will pick you up from the airport if you request in advance.

Reviews.Title: “a nice little Gem with the friendliest, warmest staff”
Reviews.Author: kellylovesmiami
Reviews.Content: I am a local Miami Beach resident, this past week when all of a sudden my place started having some electrical issues, I had to find a place to stay as well as work. The building concierge recommended the New Yorker, I can't believe I didn't know about this place that is so close to where I live. I stayed in their suite which was extremely spacious, super clean and even had a nice reading area with a super cute kitchenette. The staff was the nicest (Jerri, Mimi and the owners) were always so helpful and always ready to recommend wonderful places to eat within the area, one night I even tried Michy's which is Michelle Bernstein's wonderful restaurant. I will definitely stay here again as well as recommend it to family and friends when they are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: MJR05
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last year in october for my birthday. and miami was an amzing city. even though the hotel wasnt located in the best area of miami, we and my girlfriend rented a moped and was able to get to every location recommend to us by walter and shirley, plus the reception staff. i dont care what the bad reviews say as i was here for a week, loved the place, there were also nice resturants situated in the area which were beautiful, there was a pizza shop 5mins down the road, and balans across the road. this is also a nice cheap hotel with everything you require, i am happy to say, that when i am next in miami, i will be staying here again, due to the friendlyness of the staff

Reviews.Title: “Good for a motel!”
Reviews.Author: Linette D
Reviews.Content: This motel is not in the best area of Miami. You do see hookers at night time walking around. I must admit that it is very CLEAN! rooms are small but modern. They are cute and bathrooms are clean. The BAD thing is the noise. Since It is next to the highway you hear the cars and people talking outside. They do provide ear plugs. Another bad thing is that you CAN NOT control your air conditioner from your room. It is central a/c and it got Hot at night. They do have ceiling fans. If you like cold a/c, then this is not the place for you! Breakfast was simple, but enough. Bagels, bananas and croissants. The staff was very nice, as well as the owners. I stayed with my kids and boyfriend. If you are looking for a clean place to crash in budget then this one is it. I have payed $130 in south beach and it stunk so bad. I souls stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “We Thought it Was a Great Find”
Reviews.Author: CocoinParadise
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for one night and were very happy to have been given the tip that this was a great place from a cop named A.J. The room was art deco and immaculate, there was a refrigerator, parking was free, as was wi-fi, AND the FREE breakfast was certainly a big plus! Also, the staff, all of them, were extremely friendly and helpful. It is not a fancy place, and the street is noisy, but it is very clean and affordable for those traveling on a budget. We enjoyed our stay and will be back! A big "hi" to Jerry!

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: NinMa188593
Reviews.Content: This was a nice place to stay for some nights. Clean fresh rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Reality”
Reviews.Author: takaput
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a couple of days while on a mini vaca. It's super cute hotel with art deco style decorations in the rooms. Breakfast was simple but satisfying with a variety of bagels, jam, and cereals. Staff is very nice. Overall, very comfortable mom and pop place for a great price!!

Reviews.Title: “As a last resort ONLY!!”
Reviews.Author: FlyJetSetter
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my husband and we arrived at the hotel late. The neighborhood is SCARY! First red flag were all the police we saw in the street, second was all the people wondering around up to who know what in the middle of the night and then the third was that they lock the lobby doors and you have to get buzzed in. When we arrived there was no parking in front of the hotel. We could not sleep well because we were too worried about our car. If it hadn't been so late and we hadn't booked online we would have left immediately! We did not stay there the next night we paid $20 more to stay at a well known hotel downtown (Well worth it).The walls are thin here! We woke up hearing our neighbors TV. Speaking of, the tv reception was no good and we mostly only got spanish speaking channels. If I could do over I wouldn't have stayed here. This hotel is not a family hotel or for people looking to get some rest!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Hip, Great Location, and all for a reasonable Price!”
Reviews.Author: MrbizKid
Reviews.Content: I believe in giving a FAIR and BALANCED review no matter what the experience was like. This is about as REAL as a review you will see on this property. Pros Free Wifi (although it was slow at times) Free Parking (although there were very few spots and they were in tight spaces) Free Breakfast Excellent location - close to all the fun that Miami has to offer Staff was extremely friendly and accommodating Room was neat and clean and contained a hip, bright, Miami decor with a mini fridge, remote controlled ceiling fan/light, and flat screen TV. Grounds were kept nicely and the pool area was clean. Price was VERY reasonable (so reasonable that I ended up staying an extra week) Safe area that often times had police patrolling right outside the building. Ask for room 224... It was the best! Cons Located on one of Miami's a busiest street so it was noisy for most of the day and night. (but hey who doesn't like the sounds of a city) Room walls are very thin and you can pretty much hear everything outside or the next room over. There weren't many channels on the satellite TV, unless you understand Spanish (however there were 3 premium movie channels) The AC was not individually controlled and was one temperature for the whole building. So at times it was either too cold or too hot. For me it was too hot. (however the rooms have remote controlled ceiling fans)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent alternative to Miami beach”
Reviews.Author: sdm789
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2011, the building had recently been entirely refurbished (and a new wing constructed) so the rooms were clean and fresh. Location is central, a good base from which to explore Miami beach, airport, downtown, little havana, and the Everglades... all an easy drive. And parking here is free, a rare luxury in Miami. Our favourite part was breakfast - self-service in a pleasant courtyard. Yes it was simple, but there was everything we needed and we were free to bring a few items of our own too. If you don't wish to go too far for dinner, there are some good restaurants within walking distance. The only downside was the noise of the highway, which can be expected when one goes to a former motel, however we do wonder why even the new wing has been built with the classic American motel paper-thin walls. We would recommend taking a pool view room (first floor) to minimize the road noise. Good hotel, friendly and helpful staff, would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware”
Reviews.Author: MsA71
Reviews.Content: The price was great for a clean room with comfortable beds, free Wi-Fi, and free parking. But it is still a basic package...no coffee makers, no controls for the air (though it is kept at comfortable temps), not even a phone in the room. The staff is friendly, but does not remotely have the sophistication of a hotel concierge. The motel is conveniently located for quick trips by car, but not pedestrian friendly. The neighborhood is sketchy, but clean. Hard to judge how safe the immediate area is. The noise is a BIG issue! The refurbished motel was probably built before the area became a high traffic street. The street noise penetrates even when it's light, and it's doubtful anything could be done to dampen the noise. The motel provides ear plugs in the rooms, but even that was not enough...and I'm a HEAVY sleeper. If you are unfortunate enough to have "neighbors" as I did one night, there will be even more noise, even when they are talking at normal volume levels, worse if they turn on their TV. The walls are not paper thin, but the motel is situated a few feet from the street, and the sound bounces off the walls instead of being absorbed. It's only amplified. While there's nothing the staff/motel does wrong, the enviroment is cannot be made peaceful. In short, it's near impossible to have a restful stay....unless you medicate yourself HEAVILY.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty, Trashy, Dirty, Gross,”
Reviews.Author: 2011bruno2011
Reviews.Content: If you like roaches everywhere then this place is for you. it is in a crappy location next to NOTHING. If your running from the police go here-

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: amylin0824
Reviews.Content: Although it is not located in a good area, it's a nice and clean place to stay. The staffs are very friendly and helpful. I personally liked their breakfast very much, cus I love fruit for breakfast and they have bananas, mangoes and apples.

Reviews.Title: “Love the place, the people... and I certainly will stay with them again”
Reviews.Author: Drica35
Reviews.Content: This is a really good place to stay. Clean, cute, and with a great customer service, love the breakfast, the good mood of everyone... if you want to stay in a very nice place, this is the one. I was by myself, first time in MIA and love it!... for the price, is just a great deal... but have a car is also a good ideia, because it takes a little more time if you are by bus like me, and if you want to visit several different places...The bus stop is really across the avenue and is not exactly necessary to have a car. Also the new yorker has a great shuttle service from and to the airport. Jerry, IÂ´ll return for shure... sorry for the delay in the review! kisses from Brazil

Reviews.Title: “really good”
Reviews.Author: Gluu
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at New Yorker and we really liked it. It is clean, renovated and quiet. We loved the big pool and it was open until late at night. Complimentary breakfast (tea, coffee, juice, toasts, cereals, fruits) in the patio, free wifi, free parking. Recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “New Yorker Boutique EXCELLENT!!”
Reviews.Author: Gregory1989
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the money it is located right downtown from the arena and shopping. Also offers free wifi and free parking BIG PLUS! Ms. Jackie at the desk was WONDERFUL and can help you find anything in the area for you tourists looking to stay here. 10/10 hotel if I every come to miami again I will be staying here! Also they were doing some renovations during my stay so I can't imagine what they will provide next?!?! Ammenities include:hr pool....flat scren televisions.....

Reviews.Title: “Sweet little spot with some cool rooms”
Reviews.Author: 8renden
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the New Yorker for 6 nights now and it has been real cool. It is a short easy drive to south beach. Right down the street from down town Miami with some of the hottest night life in the world. Several nice bars, grills and restaurants within walking distance. There is a very nice little park across the street which makes for a nice view from the front of the building. Very well decorated for the area, it really matches the MiMo development plan for the area. I stayed in a queen room and a king room and they where both well kept, clean, with very hip and mind easing decor. The beds where very comfy with 4 pillows and a very nice comforter. The bathrooms were quite small but extremely accommodating for my needs. Very ample closet space and the king room having a nice built-in wardrobe with a space for your folding clothes, shoes and hanging garments as well. There is a pool and it is nice to swim in on a hot summer day. They also have a very chill little court yard where they serve a continental breakfast. The staff was very helpful and super friendly. It is on the side of a very busy road going into downtown Miami. It might be loud for some, but they do put some very nice ear plugs in the room for you. I can sleep through war so this was not a problem for me. Even though it is a bit seedy in the area the locals all say it is getting better by the day. And for me the area was more of a journey into the culture of on the the largest most hip city's in North America. All in all this place WILL NOT let you down.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelloverCt
Reviews.Content: I was there April 30th with a friend to stay in Miami before a cruise. I have to say I was quite surprised at how cute the room was. It was modern, clean and very comfortable. They do have a pool that could have probably been more clean but it was clean enough to swim in ( I swam for about 15 mintues). The employees were extremely helpful with finding a restaurant and calling around for us. We ended up dining at UVA 69 and were very pleased. We walked there and felt safe. We did the pickup at the airport and drop off at the cruise dock. The driver drove a little fast for my taste but any taxi does the same.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and well priced”
Reviews.Author: Crlygrl
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel! It was very nicely done. they did a nice job of keeping the existing hotel structure and updating the interior. We really enjoyed the patio in the back where they serve breakfast. This area is definitely transitional but anyone who has lived in or near a city understands what "up and coming" neighborhood means. It was a great price and not a far drive from Miami beach and some nice restaurants. The staff at the front desk were very nice and helpful. Really good people. I really like patronizing places like this b/c I feel like the people are really invested in the place.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy little place with Great customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Bmartin005
Reviews.Content: We stumbled accross this hotel while searching for a place to stay before and after our cruise. The property is totally remodled with current and trendy furnishings. What made the property really stand out was the service the owners, Shirley & Walter provided us with. We were able to leave our cars there while we cruised, they took us and picked us up from the port. The Breakfast is managed by a wonderful young man named chris, with a warm smile and great personality. The huge pool was right outside the room and great for a morning swim. My only issue was the thin floors. We could literally hear every step the people over us made. It sounded like they were moving furniture. This may have been a fluke as the rest of our party had no noise issues. This will be my official Miami hotel from now on..

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem hidden on Biscayne that should not be prejudged from the outside.”
Reviews.Author: JMDewitt
Reviews.Content: I first stayed one night,last week, before my cruise. I was a little leary at first as it is located across the street from a local park but to my surprise, police presence was constant, so I felt secure. Room was very comfortable,quiet and very clean. Came back one week later after my cruise, after making a reservation the previous week. Surprisingly, on a holiday weekend, the room rate was the same as the week prior. I was put in a slightly larger room across from the pool and able to park my car at my room door ( how convenient is that?!). OMG! The shower water pressure is amazing! Loved it! Nice continental breakfast in well maintained patio area....I enjoyed fresh mango from the tree each morning and Cuban coffee made upon request. When I come back to Miami, this place will be my first choice of places to stay! The staff that I encountered were super sweet, from the manager down to Charles who handles the continental breakfast. I hope they will always have a room by the pool available when i come to town. Thanks for a great stay New Yorker of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service, loved the New Yorker!”
Reviews.Author: bvwinbristol
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Miami and we booked the New Yorker after reading the Trip Advisor reviews. We did a fly drive to Miami and arranged accommodation in Miami, Islamorada, Naples and Fort Lauderdale and ended our holiday with a 3 day cruise to the Bahamas. We stayed at the New Yorker at the start of our holiday and also after our cruise before flying home. My wife and I and 2 friends loved the New Yorker. The friendly staff gave us such a memorable stay, I wish every hotel could be so friendly and helpful. The hotel is only 15 minutes from the airport and South Beach took us 10 minutes in the car. The hotel will pick you up and take you to the airport and after returning from our cruise it was only a $25 taxi fare from the Cruise Terminal which took 20 mins. The rooms were very comfortable, air conditioned, large flat screen TV, fridge, iron and ironing board and a huge bed :) Continental breakfast outside in a large shady courtyard was delightful. The swimming pool and sun loungers/chairs were lovely. The hotel was spotless, so clean and tidy. 100 yards away was Balans restaurant which gave us a 10% discount as we were staying at the New Yorker, great food there :) The 4 of us loved the New Yorker and we would like to thank the staff there for making it such a pleasant stay, we look forward to seeing you again.

Reviews.Title: “Seems OK at first, until you haven't slept for three days.”
Reviews.Author: improv_1
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here over a quick trip to Miami. Although the owners clearly have made an effort to spruce up the joint, it falls far short. The rooms are not carpeted and there no throw rugs separating your feet from a rather scuzzy tile floor. Lots of things were missing: a channel guide, batteries to the remote (which we tried twice to have replaced, failing both times), security bars on the windows (it's not in the greatest neighborhood and we were on the first floor), no iron (although there was an ironing board) and cups for drinking. What was included were several sets of earplugs, and now we know why. Between the street noise and that of the tenants above and beside you (because their room isn't carpeted either and all that is separating you from them is 2 feet of concrete so every shoed footfall is heard, every scrape of the suitcase, every accidental drop of the non-functioning remote), you can barely hear yourself think, let alone sleep. Loudness really was the worst problem. At the price, it really wasn't worth it for us. The best attributes of this place are its location, the few cute attempts at art deco decor and the woman who worked the front desk- she was hilarious and had a great attitude.

Reviews.Title: “"What a wonderful stay"”
Reviews.Author: Frida007019
Reviews.Content: I live in Coral Gables, and had to stay away from my house for termite problems, me and my two kids were looking for a place closed to the good restaurants and the artsy crowd, we decided to go around the district and Biscayne, it is an upcoming area but we are from Miami, we know where to go, I found this very cute hotel right by my favor restaurant...what a great experience, and the most important of all, "super clean rooms and bathroom", really amazed me!!!Very welcoming place and inexpensive. I strongly recommend this hotel boutique to anyone, that wants to be closed to all the great restaurants, galeries and art events and off course enjoy the smell of clean bed sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Feelinbeachy43
Reviews.Content: Me and my cousin was looking for an inexpensive weekend get-away and what better place than Miami? Hotels on "the strip" were out of the budget for the weekend, so her Mom sent us a link to New Yorker. I must admit, we were skeptical but decided to go ahead and book it and agreed that we could change once we arrived if we choose to do so. Boy were we surpised! Hotel is clean, beds were uber-comfortable and we felt very safe (2 females traveling). The breakfast/free parking was an added bonus. You do need a car in order to get around to get to South Beach or any other attraction since the hotel is off the beaten path. Other than that, do not hesitate to book!

Reviews.Title: “Its not the Ritz but it sure aint the Pits:)”
Reviews.Author: arealqt76
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this lil gem during the last week of April and 1st week of May. The hotel itself is kinda cute very comfortable and extremely clean. The staff is ultra friendly and they go out of their way to make sure that you are ok. The pool is small but it is very nice and the outdoor breakfast is a plus the young man that handles the breakfast is very sweet he made us smile every morning. You are in an area that is on the rise and only about a 10 minute car ride from South Beach and the nightlife. I would suggest this hotel to anyone looking to have a comfy place to stay with friendly staff.....not to mention they have a free parking lot so I am sold:)

Reviews.Title: “The Fawlty Towers of Miami”
Reviews.Author: ron_jaym
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" is a basically refurbished Art Deco style motel in a dubious neighborhood. The front staff are pretty unhelpful - for example, when asked how to get to South Beach the reply was just a shrug. We finally worked out a bus route. As this motel is a long way from any attractions, having a working knowledge or map of the transit system would have been helpful. The air-conditioning is non existent. The rooms are basic with no phone or clock. Wires were sticking out of the walls. When we reported a leaking tap flooding the bathroom and carpet, it took 2 days to fix. Oh well, it's not my carpet. The included breakfast is ok, but again pretty basic. The rate was $120 per night, I suggest it is worth about $80. if you don't have a car don't bother, stay in downtown or South Beach area.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for money”
Reviews.Author: Charly333
Reviews.Content: Given the quite mixed reviews for the New Yorker on trip advisor I was not quite sure what to expect when I arrived. However, having spent 3 great nights here I am a massive fan. Having booked the hotel myself I was quite aware that it was extremely affordable, not in a particularly "glamorous" location and located right on the main road. I think the people who have criticised the New Yorker on this website must not have known (or forgotten) these main points and therefore had unrealistic expectations. Given the cost, I think the accommodation is excellent value. The building itself is really charming, the pool is real added bonus, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful, the breakfast is great, the rooms are spotless (and air-conditioned) and the shower room is totally adequate. I agree with others who have remarked that it is useful to have your own car if staying at the New Yorker. There is not a great deal in the vicinity of the motel that will detain tourists for too long. That said, taxis to other key areas are not too expensive. I loved Miami and I loved all the different parts of the city (particularly South Beach and Coral Gables). I have no regrets in choosing to economise on accommodation so I could spend more money enjoying all the other great things there are to do in the city (particularly eating!)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: mooreao
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Yorker over New Year's and had a great time. The owner, Walter, and the rest of the staff put the guest No. 1 and will do just about anything for you. Walter picked us up from the airport, took us back to pick up our rental car, dropped us off at a bar for New Year's Eve and gave us a little tour of Miami. The rooms are nice and refurbished. We stayed in a room with a massive king bed. The area the hotel is in is up and coming, but there are a few restaurants starting to move in. Just ask the staff for suggestions. The hotel itself is not on South Beach, but with a rental car only about 10 minutes away. If you don't have a car, it is about 30 minutes by bus. A taxi or Walter is also available. The only problem were some really loud guests in the room under ours that Walter took care of when we complained. Definitely recommend this hotel if you don't want to pay the big South Beach prices!

Reviews.Title: “Awful-Asolutely NOTHING like website pictures.”
Reviews.Author: draylore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at quite a few "boutique" hotels and this is ABSOLUTELY not one. The website doesn't mention that it's in a horrible part of town, that the rooms are dark, scuffed wall, loud air-conditioner, weird smell in the room. It is really nothing better than any motel you could stay at down the street, the only difference is that this one PRETENDS to be better. The owner refused to refund us for the night even though we realized after 10 minutes that it was NOTHING like their website stated and we wanted to go some nicer for our honeymoon. Not only were we throughly disappointed in the room and neighborhood, the fact that every time someone reviews this place with anything remotely negative, the owner responds with combative and condescending remarks makes me realize that not only does the hotel/motel have NO class, neither does the owner.

Reviews.Title: “Small is beautiful - the New Yorker is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PIPERScotland_UK
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Miami for a pre cruise stay of 3 nights. Unfortunately due to a miscommunication, our requested shuttle at the airport did not meet us. We eventually took a taxi which cost $30. The New Yorker is a small two storey motel. The rooms were spotlessly clean with complimentary toiletries, lots of towels and comfortable beds. There is a very nice swimming pool with comfortable sun loungers and a lovely spot outdoors for breakfast. Breakfast was buffet style and consisted of croissants, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, bagels, juice, tea and coffee. There was a nice restaurant called Ballans across the road, and a bit further along to the left, was a variety of eating establishments. A couple of minutes walk from the motel is a small supermarket. When Walter, the owner, realised that we had been let down by the shuttle he offered to take us free of charge back to the airport on our return trip. He also took us on a complimentary tour in his mini van around South Beach and the surrounding area before dropping us off at the Port for our cruise. He is a lovely person and its obvious that he is dedicated to providing an excellent experience for all guests. Here is an example: he spotted us out walking when he was in his car and when he realised we were walking to the Publix supermarket, insisted on taking us there! It was easy to get a bus back to the motel when we had finished our shopping. We hired a 'day room' at the New Yorker after the cruise as our flight was not until early evening. The rates were excellent and we got a discount as we had already stayed there. It gave us the chance to relax around the pool and use the room until it was time for our shuttle to the airport. If we are ever in Miami again, we will definitely stay here - in bigger establishments you just don't get the level of service that we experienced at the New Yorker

Reviews.Title: “A fresh coat of paint”
Reviews.Author: ckampy
Reviews.Content: This is an old roadside motel that's been updated with a modern color pallette, some ikea furniture and a "New York" concept. The room was clean, although there was no phone or clock and the AC was minimal to non-existent so good thing there was an overhead fan. Pool ok, comp breakfast not up to par even for a freebie. Staff is young and friendly, too friendly at times which got somewhat annoying when we just wanted directions to the nearest coffee shop and got a 20 minute diatribe on local attractions (which we were not looking for as we were in town for a wedding with a full schedule). We did have an odd issue with the overhead fan/light turning on and off on it's own throughout the first night we were here. When it happened again the second night we couldn't sleep and ended up having to change rooms at 4am. The staff was nice about it, but it was very annoying and probably the result of an old/cheap wiring system... although we also think it could have been something more supernatural going on, not sure but possible that there are some spirits lurking if you believe in that kind of thing. Need a car to get around definitely. Overall nice stay, would probably come again if we were in town visiting friends, but not if we were looking for a beach vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nica hotel, good price/value”
Reviews.Author: Guybrush79
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean rooms, good position (close to the Design District, Financial District and South Beach). The food mart next to the hotel doesn't look like a very safe place, however the police is there very often. The restaurant across the street (Balans) is very good and offers a 10% discounts to New Yorker's guests. Breakfast is free and OK. Great wi-fi internet connection available all over the hotel area. The only negative note: I'm still waiting for a pair of sunglasses I left in my room, I hope the staff will let me know !!

Reviews.Title: “Good value , super helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: AlRussell26
Reviews.Content: Stay here for 2 nights to visit Miami - Very good value, staff could not have been more helpful. Free light breakfast in their courtyard was nice touch. Good size pool which we enjoyed. Rooms were basic and clean. Would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the New Yorker for 2 nights while on vacation in Florida. We got an amazing deal ($59 per night) and the reviews on TripAdvisor were good, so we decided to stay there while in Miami. Everything in the room was brand new; it felt like we were one of the first to stay in the room after renovation. We had a couple of problems with the ceiling fan, light and airconditioning, and staff came to the room immediately and were very responsive to our concerns. We loved staying in the MiMo neighborhood. The New Yorker is one of the first hotels to be renovated, but there are several excellent restaurants within a couple of blocks. Balans was very good and we got a 10% discount by showing our hotel room key. A little further up Biscayne Blvd is Lo De Lea, an excellent Argentinean restuarant. We enjoyed our meal there very much. There is also a highly rated restaurant called Michy's, but we didn't try it.. If you have a car, the New Yorker is very centrally located. We drove to various destinations in Miami veryquickly from the hotel. We were on the side of the hotel facing the road, but the traffic noise didn't bother us at all. Definitely a terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “This is a nice two star motel with Nostalgic Significance”
Reviews.Author: kelmac48
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful and they are doing a great job updating this old motel on highway 1.
