I live near Route 66 in the west, and I understand the historical significance of old motor inns, such as the New Yorker. I think it is great, what the owners are doing to bring this property back to it's roots. GOOD: --great staff with some nice perks (free parking, free internet, shuttle services) --small, but clean rooms --nice beds and linens --wall mounted flat screen TV --nice pool area --free parking BAD: --my room's A/C unit was very weak (took ten hours to cool from 79 to 72) --they had to low ball the new windows; no double pane glass; very little sound proofing --bathroom was so small it was difficult to prep --weak lighting in the room UGLY: --you are 50 feet from Biscayne Blvd Highway 1 --the neighborhood is making a come back -- parts of it --I felt safe, but guarded Many people will love this well run historic motel and I truly hope the owner's make it!! I will probably go back to scoring four star hotels on Priceline/Hotwire for less than $100 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: serap
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on our honeymoon, 2 nights in a queen room and 1 night in the honeymoon suite and were overall impressed with the hotel as it offered good value for money. It is in a great area in the MiMo district on Biscayne Boulevard - there are cool retro motels all around, and some great restaurants just a couple of blocks away. I didn't find the noise bad at all and didn't use the earplugs provided. The complimentary breakfast was good, and the outdoor dining area was really charming. Most of the staff at the hotel were really friendly - although there were a couple of night staff who didn't seem to know what they were doing and checking in took absolutely ages, which is a pet hate of mine. Kevin in particular was very helpful and has good local knowledge. I think this hotel does what it sets out to - it is retro, clean and comfortable (the pillows in particular were really good). However, I did think that a little more could be put into the rooms as they were quite bare. The was only 1 bedside table and no pictures on the walls in the queen room. The honeymoon suite was better but still the bed-side tables and lamps didn't match and the tv stand looked really cheap. I think these things could be updated without losing the feel of the place (in fact, it would enhance it). The bathrooms are really tiny - which cannot be altered, I understand, but it is still worth mentioning as it was a bit of a shock when we first got there. At the end of our honeymoon we stayed in a hotel on South Beach that was more expensive and completely disgusting. Should I ever visit Miami again, I wouldn't hesitate to book the New Yorker.

Reviews.Title: “The people make this wonderful place outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: jenniearrington
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New Yorker just last week for only one night. My travel plans had been interrupted by a family emergency, and the staff there made me feel like I was surrounded by people who cared. I would never have been treated this way in a "name brand" facility. The retro-inspired accommodations will make you smile, and the grounds are exceptionally well-kept. Bonus - the shuttle service is far more economical for than taxi, and terrific restaurants are within walking distance. When I go to Miami, I'll be a "New Yorker" again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: esterxiola
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night to break up our 20 hour flight from Uruguay to Fairbanks, Alaska. They were having computer problems and there was a delay with our airport pick-up. We called when we landed, but still ended up waiting about an hour for the shuttle. The manager and front desk staff made up for it as soon as we arrived at the hotel. They got us a room immediately even though it was 6 am. The room was very clean and quiet. I wanted to stay within walking distance to Michy's, a very good restaurant nearby and this place suited my needs perfectly. A taxi driver told us the neighborhood was not great, but I did not feel uncomfortable at all walking about 4 blocks to the restaurant. My advice, if you are traveling as a couple, take a cab from the airport, it's about the same price and you don't have to wait for the shuttle to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and staff..nice place to stay in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: tjandpaytonmom
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday evening for the purpose of my boyfriend's birthday-was taking him to the Heat game on Sunday and made a weekend out of it. The parking was an issue as the place was totally booked, but we managed to find a space. The room was very nice and clean.. was definitely on the smaller side, but it had a nice tv, refrigerator and the decor was a nice change from the normal chain hotels. The price was great and the location, while not on the beach, was certainly convenient to where we wanted to go. Breakfast was served out in the courtyard and we were always greeted by cheerful staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not new, but definitely nice”
Reviews.Author: WYbirdwatcher
Reviews.Content: Overall a very pleasant experience. The room was dated and fairly plain, but comfortable and certainly a great value when compared to prices being sought by South Beach accomodations. Lights, ceiling fan, plumbing, and air conditioning were all functioning fine. Road noise, noted by other reviewers in the past, was not an issue for us, even though we were in a room that faced the highway (and our hearing is fine). The staff and managers were very friendly and eager to please. They pointed us to a great Cuban restaurant a ways up the road and made it a point to check in on us to make sure the room was OK shortly after we registered. Legion Park is right across the street, sited on the west shore of Biscayne Bay. Highly recommended as a value option.

Reviews.Title: “perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: marecek
Reviews.Content: very helpful staff, perfectly clean room,excellent bed. photos are accurate. I felt good in this hotel. i was satisfied. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Service makes the difference - and it is definitely there at the New Yorker's!”
Reviews.Author: Frunky
Reviews.Content: As Walter (the hotel Manager) says, the place is not a luxury hotel. In fact, this is a 'middle of the road' three star hotel/motel. It is located on the busy Byscaine street (US 1) that crosses the US from Key West to the Northern States. In that case, the street noise is quite understandable. The location is not the typical South Miami Beach neighborhood for tourists but gives a nice feel of what Miami is all about. One who has a car would not feel at a disadvantage with the location. I did not have a car, but benefited from the Hotel shuttle for Miami Airport and to the cruise terminal. In addition, the staff kindly drove me to the Aventura Mall and picked me up at the time I had requested. Tell me about good service! The morning breakfast was good enough. It was a continental breakfast included in the room price. For a three star hotel, I felt it was better than what I had typically found. I initially had a noisy room right on Biscayne street. However, the staff was able to accomodate my request to move. I ended up in the rear section and enjoyed a good night sleep. Wireless was available in the room, that was a big plus for me. I did not find the area particularly unsafe to walk at night. When I first arrived, I felt a little worry about the area but I quickly realized I had some pre-conceived ideas. Last but not least, the value. The service from the hotel is way superior to any other hotel who offers a room at a similar cost. The value you get by choosing that place is hard to beat in Miami area!

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: WoodsNV
Reviews.Content: When I pulled up, my first thought were "No way!!"...The front desk staff quickly assured me that they were actually in a transition neighborhood, which offered little assurance, but after going in my room, I was shocked and very pleased. It was clean, comfortable and quite frankly the best sleep that I actually got while I was in FL for the week. I would definitely recommend to anyone if they are looking for affordable lodging that isn't too far away from "fun"

Reviews.Title: “Horrible location, great service, smelly room - would NOT stay here again”
Reviews.Author: keerstn
Reviews.Content: Pay the extra $$ to stay near the port if you're cruising! This was NOT a good choice for our one-night, pre-cruise stay. The website photos are very misleading - this is NOT a glamorous place. (The first thing I did was check for bed bugs - thankfully, none there.) Miami itself is not a safe place - but the neighborhood where this hotel is located is MUCH worse than the area by the port. We saved $ by staying here - but the room was still over $100. We didn't feel safe walking out of our room, although we had a nice dinner across the street at the ONE place within walking distance we could eat. Then we raced back to the hotel and deadbolted our door. The bleach stench from the hotel room was absolutely overbearing - I mean, I was actually concerned about brain damage. We left the door open for a little while and put on the fan, but only for a few minutes because of the street noise/people outside. The bed was comfortable but the bathroom tiles were cracked and painted over. The shower was OK - the whole bathroom was newly painted. We ran a very loud noisemaker all night but were awakened several times by the roar of traffic. And when we awoke to our free continental breakfast, it was inedible - stale donuts and a few small boxes of cereal. The staff, however, couldn't be more pleasant. Truly nice folks who were doing the best they can, given that their hotel is in a neighborhood where hotels simply should not be.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Fromourpointofview
Reviews.Content: We thought the New Yorker was absolutely fine, whilst agreeing that the term "boutique" should be dropped from its title. The pick-up from the airport was good and prompt, our room was very clean (NO chemical smell), the bed was comfortable, we had a fridge and hair dryer, plenty of electrical sockets, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We used the number 3 and 16 buses to go down-town, at $2 per person for the ride - the bus stop is only yards from the hotel, and you can go to the Bay Front park with ease (and elsewhere, I'm sure). Breakfast was also fine - fruit juice, tea, coffee, a selection of cereals, bananas, apples, bagels, jams, and cream cheese. The decoration in our room was probably fairly new, and all done in the 1950's retro style. The swimming pool area was very pleasant, with extremely comfortable sun loungers, and plenty of them. There are at least 5 restaurants within easy walking distance, and these ranged from average to good. All in all, we were happy with our choice in this expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Sinppu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the TA reviews and excellent price, but this time we disagree with other TA users. The chemical smell almost knocked us over when we opened our room door for the first time. Despite all our efforts to get rid of the smell, our clothes smelled really awful for the next three days. Room was damp and hot inspite of the a/c. We had to wait over 5 minutes everytime if we wanted the shower water to heat up. The toilet flushing was plain horrible. The noise scared us for the first ten times and then we woke up every single time when anyone in the building flushed their toilet. The pick up from the airport was cheap enough but not very efficient or clear. The location is quite far from anywhere. We did anyhow get always very friendly service and the breakfast was more than adequate. Free wifi is always a bonus and the decor is bright. Unfortunately these few positive notes do not outweigh the negative ones and we will not return.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills just honest to goodness value for money”
Reviews.Author: RoseyChris
Reviews.Content: As said by most previous reviewers a clean friendly run hotel, their internet site provides an accurate picture of the property. An Art Deco period property being lovingly restored to its former glory the property is a credit to the hard working owners/staff. So many other properties in the area could do with the same TLC as this hotel. Tip 1 Balans restaurant gives a 10% discount on food and drinks on production of room key also half price drinks before 7pm we ate there and had a reasonable meal. Before 7 Stella $2.50 a quality New Zealand Sav Blanc was $4.25 A glass. Our bill with an18% obligitory tipcame to Â£15. Tip 2 Ask for a room overlooking the rear of the hotel (swimming pool) as there is a lot of noise from traffic at the front with the windows not providing good sound insulation. however this did not affect us as cleanliness and price are our priorities VFM. Thanks to the staff for making our stay such a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “A strip motel with tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Maverickgal
Reviews.Content: We booked the New Yorker pre-cruise based on their advertising as a "boutique" hotel. It isn't. It's an old motel that has new, hip and trendy furniture (wooden box bed frames, tiny plastic chairs) that isn't at all comfortable. There was no outlet in the bathroom so I dried my hair without a mirror, the A/C wall unit was in what used to be a closet so it didn't circulate well. The staff was very nice and the desk clerk carried my bag upstairs which I appreciated as there was no elevator. They had nice bathroom amenities. But Miami has much better motels for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Biscayne Boulevard Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: jsem1955
Reviews.Content: Chose TripAdvisor's 10th most popular Miami hotel to stay with my brother for 3 nights. Didn't notice that it was not listed in the AAA Florida guidebook (mea culpa). Rooms are prison cell sized and minimalist furnished except for a large flat screen TV. No individual room climate control. Ceiling fan lamp above beds. Told at front desk that if it was too cool in the room, they would lend us a space heater! We kept the outside door open 90% of the time we were in-room (except when we slept) because the room felt like a sauna (high humidity and hot). Bathroom toilets are institutional (no water tank). Functional but look awful. Room lighting was poor. Worst hotel experience in my life. Changed rooms because the promised bar fridge was missing (noticed after carrying our luggage & golf clubs up an exterior stairway to the 1st room). 2nd morning we woke up to the sound of a construction crew on the 2nd floor. Parking was cramped & awkward. We were fortunate to get a room opening onto the pool side rather than busy, noisy Biscayne Boulevard. Continental self-serve breakfast was available in an L-shaped room that felt like a walk-in closet (3 tables/6 chairs). Stayed 2 nights and forfeited the 3rd (refund denied). We couldn't deal with the discomfort any longer! Although it aspires to be an Art Deco Boutique Hotel, it fails miserably to deliver a pleasant experience to its guests.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, one of a kind experience.”
Reviews.Author: imantaylor
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the New Yorker made our experience in Miami truly wonderful. We were stuck in Miami after missing a connecting flight, and the motel was recommended by a local woman we met at the airport. The staff offered to pick us up at the airport at a cheaper price than any taxi or shuttle. The motel is centrally located, only 10 minutes from the airport, and about 15 minutes from South Beach, 25 minutes from the Everglades. They are in the process of renovating the entire 50's style motel, and we stayed in one of the updated rooms. Modern style and comfortable, with a nice pool and new lounge chairs, simple but comfortable furniture, great pillows on the bed. The updates are still in process and everything isn't ship shape yet. We had some plumbing problems in the shower, but they plan to have everything finished by next month. The best thing about the motel is the staff. They recommended places in the neighborhood to go to eat (it's still a pretty funky neighborhood with some seedier elements, but with lots of great little restaurants in walking distance, and a feeling that it's on the way up), told us how to get around the city, what sights we shouldn't miss in Miami, and they drove us into the city, picked us up, and took us back to the airport. They were so welcoming and warm and made us feel at home. This is a great place to stay, and will only get better as the motel finishes getting renovated and as the neighborhood keeps getting cleaner and safer. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “LIKE A MODERN VISIT TO THE PAST!”
Reviews.Author: MMorr
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Christmas which can be hard but not for the wonderful staff at the New Yorker. I felt like I was home and being from Chicago much warmer. I loved relaxing by the pool. The room was decorated in Decco style and had an amazing bed with a beautiful white fluffy comfoter and all the ammenities I need in a room. The shopping was easy to get to a little too easy I may have treated my self a little. I believe I am now addicted to the deliicious cuban coffee and thats a good thing except Icant find it in Chicago. I guess I'll just have to go back thanksagain to the New Yorker. Meridith Morrison

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good value !”
Reviews.Author: valynadine
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spend some days in Miami without having to spend too much money in an expensive hotel. The New Yorker Boutique Hotel was a good choice. Very friendly friendly stuff, good location, free parking (absolutely recommendable in Miami) and wifi. They even offer you towels at the reception to enjoy their pool. The walls between the rooms are very thin, this is the only negative aspect, but not a big deal...

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Thorneywork
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week and was made to feel very very welcome by the staff and owner Walter who was a star for my whole week with his help to get me about and pick me up, being always reliable and helpful. The area although initially was slightly apprehensive soon realised was a real nice place, although did not venture off the main strip other than up to 79th Street to get the L to collins and the beach. Miami is the the best City in the world for me and had a great Holiday and this was very much due to Walter his lovelly family and his team who run the hotel. I nearly forgot my room was cool always clean, plenty of space and loved the big walk in shower. Would stay there again in a heart beat, once I have paid back my credit card from this trip although that said this place is remarkable value for what it is and you get a decent continental breakfast thrown in, Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great people, great history, character property”
Reviews.Author: SamCHouston
Reviews.Content: Can't speak highly enough of the level of customer service. Very friendly, offering tips on local attractions that enhanced our visit. Made us feel very welcome indeed. Only downsides to this hotel is that it's an old property (although tastefully refurbished) and that means the soundproofing isn't upto much. I guess they know this because earplugs were provided (and needed). Our bed was also very creaky and not terribly comfortable, possibly because I'm tall (6ft4) and heavy (225lbs). Maybe lighter folks won't have problem- that said I wouldn't want to get to enthusiastic on the bed because it would probably have broken!:) Don't let that put you off though, this place is great and the included breakfast though basic was good enough. You really need a car to get around though as there isn't a massive amount to do within walking distance although there are some good bars and restaurants within a 2 min walk. Would stay here again and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy”
Reviews.Author: dragonknights
Reviews.Content: Unfriendly staff, unfriendly neighborhood, several members in our business trip were told they cannot have the room they booked because the hotel was overbooked. Not enough parking.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and Service? Oh YES!”
Reviews.Author: protocoldoug
Reviews.Content: The staff is awesome. Helpful, give great advice, courteous, to say the least. Just as a random example, I asked for change at the front desk, and while he couldn't break it for me -- he offered to go to the gas station to get change for me! That's really nice. And that's just an example, very very nice guys. I have to say, I was very very impressed. We didn't want to stay at an airport hotel before we left from a trip in the Keys, flying out of Miami. So we chose the New Yorker (based partially on the reviews here on Trip Advisor!). Very neat place, cool rooms too. We had sushi for an appetizer down the road, and then ate across the street, and the ribs were awesome (as recommended by the staff!). The neighborhood is interesting It seems to be becoming gentrified, I'd say as a wild guess and a Vermonter staying in Miami for the night. Walking around with just my fiance and I on a Monday night it was a little weird, but, Mondays are weird anywhere. I wouldn't say that's a reason to not go there, and it's probably pretty cool as you approach the weekend. You don't feel unsafe, Biscayne Boulevard has plenty of traffic and we saw police drive by on many occassions. But, I'll admit -- while I have lived in cities, I am now in full-out country bumpkin mode, so it took a little getting used to. Definitely recommend it, especially if you don't want to stay in a sterile chain hotel. It's got way more flavor and is way more fun to stay in. I say: go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: valleyblueblue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel New Yorker for 3 days before cruising on the Epic We were picked up by the hotel from airport so worth $10 each, room was great and spacious we had pizza from down the road recomended by the hotel, yum. Breakfast was good bagels,cereal,oj and tea or coffee even muffins if so desired, took ourselves off on a $5 all day bus ticket to North beach and back to the malls and wallmart. Overall loved The New Yorker Hotel would recommend a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great - enjoyable - good value”
Reviews.Author: Toby686
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 days. Our intent was to find a place that could provide easy access to the attractions and not cost an arm and a leg. Free parking and breakfast, as well as clean accommodations were very important to us and the New Yorker did not disappoint. One cannot say enough about Walter and Kevin, their eagerness to offer advice and help ensured our stay was enjoyable and stress free. As far as the Hotel/motel goes, the location provided easy access for our day trips, the room was clean and pleasant. The pool was clean and private. With food stores and restaurants close by we had everything we needed. Breakfast was simple and adequate and a nice way to start our day after a quick chat with Walter. We visited the Everglades, took a 1 day cruise to the Bahamas and toured the Keys. All in all a wonderful vacation and thanks to the New Yorker and it's staff did not break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money, good location,helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Nissysd
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in south beach, but not far from it by car. The shuttle-service for 10$ round-trip per person is a great feature. The motel (wouldn't call it a boutique-hotel) is clean, rooms have fridge and microwave. The breakfast is sufficient (bagels, bread, muffins, cereal, coffee, orange juice). The staff is very nice and their recommendation for a pizza-restaurant close-by was really good ! The area around the hotel is okay but (like most of Miami outside South Beach) you don't see a lot of pedestrians.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay”
Reviews.Author: tob123Paris_France
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice, of course it is not the Hilton but the kindness of the owner worth the trip( they really do anything possible to help you and to improve your stay). The place is clean with style the area is safe, of course we could see some police car raiding but the hotel is on Biscayne blvd which is one of the biggest blvd of Miami we had the occasion to take a walk by night several time in order to going to the restaurant and it was pretty safe. the hotel is quite close to Miami beach downtown there are a lot of restaurant and fast food near the hotel and even 2 super market. honestly we had a great trip and if we have the change to go back to Miami someday we will stay at the New Yorker Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: PF2UK
Reviews.Content: Was really looking forward to staying here but was very disappointed. The people who own it and are fixing it up are nice but I don't think they're really cut out for running a hotel/motel or have the money to do it up as it needs to be done. It's stylish - but done very cheaply and the cracks are starting to show. It's all a bit Ikea...and in a year's time I think it will look trashed. Pool is nice - which is just as well as we had to wait over an hour to check in as workmen were fixing blinds in our room. The main problem though is the area - there are some nice businesses in the area and it's definitely on the up but it's still a scary place. The first night we stayed, 13 police cars raided the motel across the street. And do not go into the convenience store next door if you value your life. We had the Coppertone room and the entrance is down a dark, dead end off the upstairs walkway - it was nerve racking going back at night. And we really thought seriously about pushing the spare bed in front of the door...so didn't relax enough to sleep well. If the whole street improves then this will be a cool place to stay but at the moment it's just a bit too edgy...

Reviews.Title: “Miami's hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: chicco
Reviews.Content: This motel style hotel is first class if you want a nice clean very friendly reasonably price hotel in Miami. Walter the manager is sooooo helpful and genuinely a friendly guy, who nothing is to much trouble for. The hotel also has a small pool. So all in all this was a super place to stay in MIami

Reviews.Title: “Splendid”
Reviews.Author: Simon_Belgium
Reviews.Content: Not far from the airport, this is a great little hotel. Recently renovated, it's really clean and everything works. Special mention to the staff, which is really friendly and helpful. Decent breakfast (bagels, cereals, coffee, orange juice, ...) A block away is "Balans", a nice little restaurant, good food, friendly staff...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: HappyMusafir
Reviews.Content: I am too lazy to write reviews but I felt compelled to write a review for this cute little motel. As other reviews indicated, we also felt a tad bit cheated with the hotel/motel confusion, especially since we reached late at night and the area seemed a little shady. BUT the rest of the stay more than convinced us that this was a great choice! Clean rooms, cute decor, comfortable bed, and the free parking, free wifi and free breakfast were great! But the real dealbreaker was the service. Our 'hosts' were very warm, friendly, helpful and genuine people. Not only did they offer prompt and good service, they also gave us a lot of helpful information for sight-seeing, restaurants, etc. All in all, GREAT value for money, and if I ever go back to Miami, I know where I am going to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: travelpano
Reviews.Content: At first glance, the New Yorker Boutique Hotel is clean, comfortable, nicely decorated, convenient (direct bus to go downtown). Having spent 5 nights there, I did appreciate all these points. Good breakfast too. But what distinguishes the most this hotel is the kindness of the owners and their real sense of service. They have been very helpful for our little group, giving advice for visiting Miami, Everglades and Keys, and making our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zenhaus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the New Yorker while passing through Miami en route to the Keys. The rooms are newly remodeled to look like they're straight out of the 50's. The price was right, the room was clean and the staff was very helpful in recommending places to eat around the area. The only downside was that you could hear noise (Normal talking levels, toilet flushes and a running sink) from the adjacent rooms, although it wasn't too terrible. The design and cleanliness of the room and the helpfulness of the staff easily made up for it. I would definitely stay at the New Yorker again.

Reviews.Title: “Firstly, this place is a motel not a...”
Reviews.Author: teenagemum
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this place is a motel not a hotel but it does what it says on the tin. Very helpful staff & nice clean room. I arrived late & was pointed in the direction of a nice local restaurant/bar which was perfect. The area is quite a way from south beach etc so you would definitely need a car, perfect as an overnight stop if en route to somewhere else. I arrived from the Everglades & it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: wmpape
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the motel. For the price its hard to beat. Friendly and helpful staff..and the breakfast is a nice touch considering the rates. I loved the pool too. At least two good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean and charming residence!”
Reviews.Author: Panimi
Reviews.Content: This little Hotel in Miami is a very beautiful, extremly clean and nice place to stay and very central (10 minutes from airport, 10 minutes from great beach)- we will always come back when we visit Miami. The owners are so friendly and helpful, made our stay very, very special! There is perfect service, breakfast and Internet, you can park for free and have a very nice swimming pool. We can recommend this place by heart. Good price, best quality!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: 1Shish
Reviews.Content: I chose the New Yorker Hotel because of location, price, and most importantly, the reviews on Trip Advisor. Not only was I not disappointed, I was totally thrilled by the level of service and courtesy we received from the entire staff. Local friends advised against the area, however, we found it to be an extremely charming up-and-coming neighborhood. The room was clean and offered a retro feel with modern amenities. The staff suggested Bolans Cafe for breakfast which was only a block away and the food was fantastic. We will definitely suggest this hotel to our friends and visit again on our next kayaking trip in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: HLS1717
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for 4 nights and were very pleasantly surprised with the charm and personality of the hotel and the neighborhood. This older hotel has been renovated with modern furnishings and colors, which we found very charming. the beds were new and comfortable, the A/C, ceiling fan and flat screen TV were all great. Breakfast was provided, and the owners and staff were exceedingly friendly and gave us great local advice on places to visit in the city. The room was cleaned daily and left smelling fresh and neat while we were at breakfast. My only small complaints were the security lights outside the rooms gave off enough light during the night to lighten the room more than my husband liked, and the water pressure and hot water in the shower likely are still operating on an older system. But those were small issues and overall we were both extremely pleased with the hotel and would stay there again. There were plenty of interesting restaurants and locally-owned shops within walking distance. It seems that this neighborhood is on the upswing, yet still very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “For value for money, comfort, cleanliness, location, fantastic staff and the whole ambiance of the place this is a must”
Reviews.Author: pursglove
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Miami and as an Englishman didn't quite know what to expect. We were recommended to stay in the newly refurbished New Yorker Boutique Hotel and wow what a gem, it is a family run business and nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. We were given directions on where to eat, what to see and how to spend our (much too short) two days there. The location was absolutely perfect with everything been so close at hand, with South Beach and the other attractions only a 10 minute drive away. A night in this hotel was possibly a quarter of the price compared to some within a short drive away. For value for money, comfort, cleanliness, location, fantastic staff and the whole ambiance of the place this is a must! Philip & Yvonne Pursglove

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with top rate owners and staff no effort spared”
Reviews.Author: charlie4855
Reviews.Content: We came to Miami without booking a hotel and stopped at many around Miami without much success for comfort and price. When we saw the lovely painted blue and white New Yorker we were impressed straight away and after being shown the rooms decided to book for 2 nights. After being there for 2 nights we booked another 5 nights as it was in a ideal place for the tennis, beach, food and downtown Miami. The owners Shirley and husband,brother Chris helped us with our every need to help us have a great holiday. We were also the first custers and it was a great honour. cheers Charlie

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: Jankita
Reviews.Content: We stayed only 2 nights but I can tell you that the New Yorker is the best 3 star hotel we have ever stayed in. Service is great to say the least! The staff is really friendly and helpful. The rooms are very tastefully decorated as well as all other areas. The place is close to down town Miami as well as to Miami Beach. You should rent a car to be flexible and move around beautiful Miami. The best about the New Yorker is the price, very affordable and really nice! We will definitely come back to stay there again

HotelInfo.Name: New Yorker Boutique Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 6500 Biscayne Boulevard, Miami, FL 33138
